00038 namespace detail {
00039 
00040 integer random_by_size(base_random_generator& gen, size_t bits, bool high_bit_on, bool
00041     low_bit_on, bool can_be_negative)
00042 {
00043     if (bits<=0) return integer::zero();
00044 
00045     // Grab a bunch of bits
00046     bitqueue_t bitqueue;
00047     while (bitqueue.size() < bits) bitqueue.push(gen(),
00048         std::numeric_limits<base_random_generator::result_type>::digits);
00049 
00050     // Stick them into an integer
00051     integer p;
00052     p._realloc((bits + bits_per_digit - 1) / bits_per_digit);
00053     digit_t *pp = p._get_writable_digits(), *ppe = pp + p._get_length();
00054     while (pp < ppe) *pp++ = static_cast<digit_t>(bitqueue.pop(bits_per_digit));
00055 
00056     // Trim it to the proper length
00057     size_t index=(bits/bits_per_digit);
00058     digit_t mask=(digit_t(1) << (bits % bits_per_digit))-1;
00059     if (mask==0) { mask=digit_mask; --index; }
00060     p._get_writable_digits()[index] &= mask;
00061     for (digit_t *i=p._get_writable_digits()+index+1,
00062         *ie=p._get_writable_digits()+p._get_length(); i<ie; ++i) *i=0;
00063     p._cleanup();
00064 
00065     if (high_bit_on) setbit(p, bits-1);
00066     if (low_bit_on) setbit(p, 0);
00067     if (can_be_negative) p._set_negative(gen() & 0x01);
00068 
00069     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(p);
00070 }
00071 
00072 } // namespace detail

00076 // The secure random generator
00077 
00079 
00080 #ifdef _WIN32
00081     struct strong_random_generator::impl_t {
00082         typedef BOOLEAN (WINAPI *RtlGenRandomFn)(PVOID, ULONG);
00083         typedef DWORD result_type;
00084 
00085         impl_t(): dll(0), fn(0) {
00086             // This should work under WinXP, Vista, and Win7. No guarantees about
00087             // future compatibility, but I doubt that Microsoft will get rid of it
00088             // (it's too useful), and I doubt that they'll change it now that it's
00089             // well-known (it would break too many programs). We could also use the
00090             // rand_s function in more recent versions of Visual C++, but that
00091             // causes compatibility problems with older versions of Windows.
00092             dll=LoadLibraryA("Advapi32.dll");
00093             if (dll != 0) fn=RtlGenRandomFn(GetProcAddress(dll, "SystemFunction036"));
00094             if (fn == 0) {
00095                 destroy();
00096                 throw exceptions::no_strong_random();
00097             }
00098         }
00099 
00100         ~impl_t() { destroy(); }
00101 
00102         result_type operator()() {
00103             result_type r=0;
00104             if (!fn(&r, sizeof(result_type)))
00105                 throw exceptions::no_strong_random("RtlGenRandom failed");
00106             return r;
00107         }
00108 
00109         void destroy() { if (dll) FreeLibrary(dll); }
00110 
00111         HMODULE dll;
00112         RtlGenRandomFn fn;
00113     };
00114 
00115     double strong_random_generator::entropy() const { return 32; }
00116 #else
00117     struct strong_random_generator::impl_t {
00118         typedef unsigned char result_type;
00119 
00120         impl_t(): rng("/dev/urandom", std::ios::binary) {
00121             // This should be supported under most non-Windows systems. Note
00122             // that we're using /dev/urandom, not /dev/random -- /dev/random is
00123             // more secure, but it can be VERY slow.
00124             if (!rng) throw exceptions::no_strong_random();
00125         }
00126 
00127         result_type operator()() {
00128             int r=rng.get();
00129             if (r==EOF) throw exceptions::no_strong_random("/dev/urandom "
00130                 "returned EOF");
00131             return static_cast<result_type>(r);
00132         }
00133 
00134         std::ifstream rng;
00135     };
00136 
00137     double strong_random_generator::entropy() const { return 8; }
00138 #endif
00139

00142 const bool strong_random_generator::has_fixed_range = true;
00143 const strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::min_value =
00144     (std::numeric_limits<impl_t::result_type>::min)();
00145 const strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::max_value =
00146     (std::numeric_limits<impl_t::result_type>::max)();
00147 strong_random_generator::strong_random_generator(): impl(new impl_t) { }
00148 strong_random_generator::~strong_random_generator() { delete impl; }
00149 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::operator()() {
00150     return (*impl)(); }
00151 
00153 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::min
00154     BOOST_PREVENT_MACRO_SUBSTITUTION () const { return min_value; }
00155 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::max
